chef_description: John Smith is a Michelin-starred chef with over 20 years of experience in the culinary industry.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Season the chicken with olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Roast the chicken for 1 hour or until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper. Sear the beef in a hot pan until browned on all sides. Brush the puff pastry with egg wash and place the beef tenderloin in the center. Spread the mushroom duxelles on top of the beef and wrap with prosciutto. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.

Boil the lobsters for 5-7 minutes or until cooked. Remove the meat from the lobsters and set aside. In a separate pot, sauté the onion, carrot, and celery until soft. Add the seafood stock and lobster meat and bring to a simmer. Add the heavy cream and simmer for another 5-10 minutes. Blend the soup until smooth and serve hot.
